stheno.graph module¶

class stheno.graph.GP[source]¶

Bases: stheno.random.RandomProcess, plum.resolvable.Referentiable

Gaussian process.

Parameters

  • kernel (kernel.Kernel) – Kernel of the process.

  • mean (mean.Mean, optional) – Mean function of the process. Defaults to zero.

  • graph (graph.Graph, optional) – Graph to attach to.

condition = <function <function GP.condition> with 2 method(s)>[source]¶
diff(dim=0)[source]¶

Differentiate the GP. See graph.Graph.diff().

diff_approx(deriv=1, order=6)[source]¶

Approximate the derivative of the GP by constructing a finite difference approximation.

Parameters

  • deriv (int) – Order of the derivative.

  • order (int) – Order of the estimate.

Returns

Approximation of the derivative of the GP.

class stheno.graph.Observations(*args, **kw_args)[source]¶

Bases: stheno.graph.AbstractObservations, plum.resolvable.Referentiable

Observations.

Can alternatively construct an instance of Observations with tuples or lists of valid constructors.

Parameters

  • x (input) – Locations of points to condition on.

  • y (tensor) – Observations to condition on.

  • ref (class.GP, optional) – Reference process. See graph.ensure_at().

K_x¶

Kernel matrix of the data.

class stheno.graph.SparseObservations[source]¶

Bases: stheno.graph.AbstractObservations, plum.resolvable.Referentiable

Observations through inducing points. Takes further arguments according to the constructor of graph.Observations.

ELBO.

Type

scalar

Parameters

  • z (input) – Locations of the inducing points.

  • e (graph.GP) – Additive, independent noise process.

A¶

Parameter of the corrective variance of the kernel of the optimal approximating distribution.

Kernel matrix of the data.

ELBO.

mu¶

Mean of optimal approximating distribution.
